AC Milan management under the ownership of the American fund Elliott have been very clear since the takeover, there would not be overspending on transfer fees or on players’ wages. That explains why the mercato of the Rossoneri is headed towards looking for valuable opportunities that add to the quality of Stefano Pioli‘s squad without spending big amounts.

In fact, according to today’s edition of the newspaper Gazzetta dello Sport, the club has set a specific limit for the wage bill.

At Casa Milan, the managers do not go beyond 4 million euros net per season. However, there are only few exceptions with Gianluigi Donnarumma and Zlatan Ibrahimovic who are allowed to earn more.

SportMediaset (via MilanLive) are reporting that Paolo Maldini, Ivan Gazidis and the rest of the management consider Donnarumma to be a pillar of the project are even willing to smash their internal salary cap in order to keep him.


There is a proposed agreement that provides for a bonus up to €1million for each season that Milan will play in the Champions League, for a duration of five seasons, which would keep away foreign clubs who might be tempted to offer a huge deal.

However, Mino Raiola has a totally different idea as he wants a €10million per year deal for only two seasons, which is something which has rocked the management despite the player’s wll to stay.

Not only is it a worry because of the instant pay hike he would receive, but also because the implication is that Raiola would take advantage of the economic recovery foreseen in two years in order to earn even more money for its client when negotiating another extension.

Coach Stefano Pioli had his say about the Rossoneri team’s loss against Spezia at the Alberto Picco stadium. Here are his statements entrusted to the microphones of DAZN

“We must react well, and we will certainly do that. Spezia won fairly and this is our first deserved loss of the season. It happens, the typical day when sometimes nothing actually functions, Spezia punished us. We must move forward after this bad night.”

“We are not a team capable of really winning ugly. We always try to remain focused and keep our intensity level and pace of the match, so if we lack those factors, we are not as effective.”

“During this game, we struggled a lot. Nothing worked including my choices and my players’ performances, of course. This is not Milan’s way. We will prove it next week.”

“We are aware of how terrible this performance was. Anyone who watched us train at Milanello this week would not have expected such a surprising performance, and yet it happened. It was an off night for the whole team, we need to immediately bounce back.”

“If we don’t move the ball around quickly enough, we allow our opponents to get back into shape and we become predictable. Nothing worked this evening on the ball or off it. It was a bad night tonight, it is right that we leave with our heads down. Tomorrow, however, we will get back to work hard.”

In view of the game against Red Star Belgrade, AC Milan’s coach Stefano Pioli spoke to Sky Sport network to discuss the upcoming challenge. Here are his statements as reported by Milannews.it:

On resuming the Europa League campaign:

“We return to a place in which Milan have often excelled. It was a long way to get here, we want to be a surprise in this competition too.”

On turnover:

“ This is a really demanding period which is taking place. In the next 18 days we will be playing six games. It will be important to dose our energies well, luckily I have almost the whole group available. I will choose a competitive team for tomorrow evening, then we will think about the derby.”

On Mandzukic:

“Mario Mandzukic is feeling very well. I think he can start from the beginning tomorrow night.”

On who should be resting on the bench:

“This is a particular and complicated season so far. We played the preliminaries and had many injuries, so some players had to play more often than usual. Now I will have to make my assessments.”

On the defeat against Vincenzo Italiano’s Spezia:

“We have to start again. We didn’t play like we are Milan and this can be a positive aspect because if we lost playing as a Milan team, we would be here to make different assessments. We have to go back to our ways. It doesn’t matter what we have done so far, but what we will do from now on does matter.”

皮狗生性了, 文素基治正選
